str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (properly a medical term: I stupefy, hence) I burden, encumber. From kata and narkao; to grow utterly torpid, i.e. slothful.
No one, none, nothing.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To come, go.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fill up by adding to, supply. From pros and anapleroo; to fill up further, i.e. Furnish fully.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From hustereo; a deficit; specially, poverty.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
Not burdensome, bringing no weight or oppression upon. Weightless, i.e. not burdensome.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
And, even, also, namely.

word: I will continue to do so.
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
